toxins.description:
in Cats
• Systemic Effects: The sources describe a toxicity that affects the central nervous system and cardiovascular system.
• Clinical Manifestations: Ingestion leads to behavioral changes, disorientation, and dilated pupils.
• Physiological Changes: The toxins cause hyperthermia (elevated body temperature) and alter vital signs, specifically causing changes in heart rate and respiratory rate.
4. Concentration and Potency
• Deterrents: The plant possesses a strong odor that naturally deters most pets from nibbling on the leaves, though ingestion still occurs.
• Urgency: The toxicity is severe enough that immediate veterinary care is advised if ingestion is suspected.• The top 12 most poisonous plants for pets - Avonvale Veterinary Centre

treatments.name: Emergency Veterinary Consultation/Examination
treatments.description: Seek veterinary care immediately if ingestion is suspected. Do not wait for symptoms to appear. The plant is noted to cause severe systemic effects that can escalate quickly.
treatments.notes: Angel's Trumpets produce beautiful blooms but are highly toxic. Although their strong odor often deters pets, ingestion still occurs and affects vital systems (heart and lungs).Management of Hyperthermia

treatments.name: Thermoregulation / Cooling Measures
treatments.description: Veterinary staff will monitor and manage the cat's body temperature.
treatments.notes: One of the distinct symptoms of Angel's Trumpet poisoning is hyperthermia (elevated body temperature), which requires stabilization to prevent organ damage.Cardiovascular and Respiratory Support

treatments.name: Cardiac and Respiratory Monitoring
treatments.description: Continuous monitoring of the heart rate and respiratory rate to manage instability.
treatments.notes: The toxins in the plant cause significant changes in heart rate and respiratory rate. Veterinary treatment will focus on stabilizing these vital signs to prevent fatal complications.Management of Neurological Symptoms

treatments.name: Neurological Support / Seizure Precautions
treatments.description: Managing behavioral changes and preventing injury due to disorientation.
treatments.notes: Cats may exhibit disorientation, dilated pupils, and behavioral changes due to the plant's effects on the central nervous system.Important Note on "Nightshade" Confusion: While Angel's Trumpet belongs to the Solanaceae (Nightshade) family, it should not be confused with the "Nightshade plants" (like tomatoes and potatoes) described in other sources as containing solanine. Angel's Trumpets contain tropane alkaloids (though not explicitly named in the provided text, the symptoms of dilated pupils and hyperthermia are consistent with this). Treatments for solanine poisoning (such as using atropine) would be inappropriate and dangerous for Angel's Trumpet ingestion, which already presents with atropine-like effects (fast heart rate, dilated pupils). Therefore, rely strictly on the specific advice for Brugmansia or Angel's Trumpets: immediate veterinary care.
